intro: Neorosea odoratissima, commonly known as the fragrant rose of the tropics, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white petals and a strong, sweet fragrance that attracts pollinators. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often trailing. Neorosea odoratissima thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic properties.
